channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple plans to hire 20,000 workers over the next four years but faces competition for AI talent
item.description: Companies across every sector are pursuing top tech talent.

item.title: Facing Trump’s Hostility, Ukraine Weighs Its Options. But They Are Few.
item.description: There is a broad reckoning in Ukraine: Washington can no longer be relied upon as a supporter. But Kyiv still has agency on the battlefield and can se...

item.title: Taiwan Detains a Chinese-Crewed Ship After Undersea Cable Severed
item.description: The Coast Guard said it was investigating how the cable was severed and said it could not rule out the possibility of sabotage.

item.title: Syria Begins National Dialogue but Without Kurdish-Led Militia
item.description: Although the conference was called to chart the country’s future, the Kurdish-led militia that controls much of Syria’s northeast was not invited.

item.title: Taiwan Detains a Chinese-Crewed Ship After Undersea Cable Severed
item.description: The Coast Guard said it was investigating how the cable was severed and said it could not rule out the possibility of sabotage.

item.title: Unilever bets on ‘maverick’ new CEO to accelerate shake-up, ousting Hein Schumacher
item.description: "The step-up from CFO to CEO by Fernandez will be liked by many investors," Jefferies analyst David Hayes said of the Unilever CEO transition.

item.title: How Can Europe Talk to Trump? Macron Tries Flattery, and Gentle Resistance.
item.description: Emmanuel Macron, the French president, epitomized how the continent’s leaders are trying to navigate President Trump’s increasingly hostile administra...

item.title: Facing Trump’s Hostility, Ukraine Weighs Its Options. But They Are Few.
item.description: There is a broad reckoning in Ukraine: Washington can no longer be relied upon as a supporter. But Kyiv still has agency on the battlefield and can se...

item.title: Milan Fashion Week dazzles with Gucci opening, but luxury sector struggles with slowdown
item.description: As Milan’s runways light up with glamour, the fashion world grapples with slumping sales, China’s slowdown, and a luxury market under pressure.

item.title: Syria Begins National Dialogue but Without Kurdish-Led Militia
item.description: Although the conference was called to chart the country’s future, the Kurdish-led militia that controls much of Syria’s northeast was not invited.

item.title: MSCI CEO: The 5 D’s reshaping global investing
item.description: Henry Fernandez says twin revolutions in data and technology are driving five big investment trends.

item.title: Attacks on DEI assume a level playing field where none exists—and threaten America’s future prosperity
item.description: Nowhere is the danger more apparent than at the intersection of race and gender—and for Black breadwinner moms in particular.

item.title: Anxious Prayers as Pope Francis Lingers in Critical Condition
item.description: Eleven days after the pope was hospitalized, speculation is mounting and prayers for his recovery verge on a vigil.

item.title: How Can Europe Talk to Trump? Macron Tries Flattery, and Gentle Resistance.
item.description: Emmanuel Macron, the French president, epitomized how the continent’s leaders are trying to navigate President Trump’s increasingly hostile administra...

item.title: President Trump’s Cuts to Medical Research
item.description: How government cuts are slowing research.
